PATIENT_ID: TEST_DROWNING_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-07 15:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-07 15:10:00
Category I activation for 16-year-old male. Drowning event with submersion.
Patient dove into shallow pool and struck head on bottom.
Submersion time approximately 3 minutes per witnesses.
Dive into shallow water with suspected cervical spine injury.
BP 100/62, HR 110, RR 24 (labored), GCS 12.
Traumatic mechanism associated with drowning event confirmed.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-07 15:15:00
Cervical collar applied. Supplemental oxygen initiated.
Patient coughing with frothy sputum. Respiratory distress noted.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-02-07 15:25:00
Trauma-directed evaluation completed. Full trauma assessment performed.
Mechanism: diving into shallow water with submersion and possible cervical injury.
Neurologic exam: moving all extremities, no focal deficit.

[IMAGING] 2026-02-07 15:40:00
CT cervical spine: no fracture or subluxation.
CT head: no intracranial abnormality.
Chest x-ray obtained: bilateral pulmonary infiltrates consistent
with aspiration. Imaging results reviewed.
